abstract_summ: China has been severely affected by Coronavirus Disease 2019(COVID-19) since December, 2019 . This study aimed to assess the population mental health burden during the epidemic . Using a web-based cross-sectional survey, we collected data from 7,236 self-selected volunteers . The overall prevalence of GAD, depressive symptoms, and sleep quality of the public were 35.1, 20.1%, and 18.2%, respectively . Young people, people spending too much time thinking about the outbreak, and healthcare workers were at high risk .
